title: What would a Labour government under Jeremy Corbyn mean for buy-to-let landlords?
text:
Buy-to-let investors have been hard-pressed of late. First came an extra 3 percentage point surcharge on second homes, then the slashing of tax relief on buy-to-let mortgages in 2017.

In London, rental yields have been low and many capital values are falling in a depressed market. Many agents have reported shrinking investor demand. But landlords could soon have more to grapple with. With an election on the horizon, a Labour government is looking increasingly possible.

Rent controls, higher taxes on investment properties, reform of tenant law and the introduction of a private tenant’s right to buy are all on the table for the buy-to-let sector. What could a government led by Jeremy Corbyn mean...
description: Buy-to-let investors have been hard-pressed of late.
